content:
I want to rent the apartment for the lowest possible price. Can you give me a starting point?

Also, I want to be on good terms with my landlord. How can I do that?

Finally, I want to negotiate the rental price. How can I do that effectively?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
I understand that you are looking for the lowest possible rental price for the apartment. Based on the size of the apartment and the current market rates in the area, I would suggest a starting point of €500 per month. However, I am open to discussing other terms that may be acceptable to both of us.

To be on good terms with your landlord, I would recommend being respectful and communicative. If you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to reach out to me. Additionally, I would suggest paying rent on time and taking care of the apartment in a reasonable manner.

When negotiating the rental price, it's important to be prepared with information on the current market rates in the area and any additional benefits or amenities that you may be able to offer. It's also important to be flexible and open to compromise. I would be happy to discuss any potential options or concessions that may be available to us.
name: Heinrich Heine

content:
I agree to the price of 450 Euro per month.

I want to ask you a few questions about the apartment. Can you tell me more about the location and the building?
